Text: credit Cc had refusals to trade due to crdit issues one from shell which is a bit surprising since i thought we cleared this last week but anyway the guys name is james blount and number for stasco is the other is socgen and this is due to some limits on gas side that they r linking the guy there is frederic naudan and his number is

RE petrobras update Cc agent just called in to say that the view in the unions is they will vote this weekend to extend the strike past sunday as the only way to twist petrobras arm he says they will not be able to shut down the refs but will lower the wick to the absolute minimum allowed by law which means about a pct reduction in distillate production Original Message From Koller Ross Sent October To Daya Mohamed Carneiro Daniella Chunchu Shilpa Clarke Niamh Cole Jim Costello Zachary Cronin Caroline Glaas Chris Haynes Mark Hill Andrew Thomas John Buckner Jones Mark Koller Ross Mahoney Chris McKinlay Tom OBrien Tony Peter Stewart Potter Darren Roche Ian Shapland Chris Spencer John Talvitie Henkka Wipp Kurt Cc White Bill Nowlan Jr John L Shankman Jeffrey A Goughary Jim Wilson John L Chismar John Subject petrobras update just talked to marcello castilho the head of petrobras office in london he gave me the following their crude production is down by mbd they have crude and product stocks for the next days but then will need to buy initially the thought wud b to buy crude however the situation may have worsened at the refineries he was pessimistic about the discussions said that petrobras called them to a meeting ydy as everyone knows and only upped the ante by pct on their side vs the sought plus the inflation catchup of pct this really angered the unions and they have now said they will not come back to the table before seeing the numbers next time he said petrobras is up against internal competition now from other oil and gas companies who are offering ex petrobras workers a pct increase over their current pay so petrobras is in a poor position so far the refs have been running at very low rates and the managers have not allowed the workers to leave the prmeises but have bunked them and fed them their in hour shifts by law they can only do this for days and some fighting has already broken out at one location so doubtful they can continue the imprisonment much longer if it comes to a bigger showdown he thinks the unions will just shut the refs down on the last shift that they work and he will be buying product not crude

petrobras update Cc talked to marcello castilho the head of petrobras office in london he gave me the following their crude production is down by mbd they have crude and product stocks for the next days but then will need to buy initially the thought wud b to buy crude however the situation may have worsened at the refineries he was pessimistic about the discussions said that petrobras called them to a meeting ydy as everyone knows and only upped the ante by pct on their side vs the sought plus the inflation catchup of pct this really angered the unions and they have now said they will not come back to the table before seeing the numbers next time he said petrobras is up against internal competition now from other oil and gas companies who are offering ex petrobras workers a pct increase over their current pay so petrobras is in a poor position so far the refs have been running at very low rates and the managers have not allowed the workers to leave the prmeises but have bunked them and fed them their in hour shifts by law they can only do this for days and some fighting has already broken out at one location so doubtful they can continue the imprisonment much longer if it comes to a bigger showdown he thinks the unions will just shut the refs down on the last shift that they work and he will be buying product not crude
